review: I was so excited over this roku stick. It met up to my expectations until I realized it wasn't completely wireless. The stick needs to be plugged in via outlet or via USB on your tv. Everything else is great but I'm not happy over it now being 100% witless. The box it came in said nothing about it having to be plugged in. I read that no several times before purchasing. Oh we'll at least it's 4 stars and awesome.

review: Just want to reiterate what others have already said. First device came with D.O. A. remote. Replacement device lasted about 7 hours then remote wouldn't sync any longer. Absolutely worthless product and terrible customer service from Roku itself. Save yourself the headache.
author: K. Quist

review: Wasn't just plug and play easy.  Had to call Roku tech support because the setup webpage and FAQ's didn't discuss the issues I ran across.  Remote wouldn't pair with base, and also it would connect to my home network, and Wifi OK, but not to the Internet and everything else in the house was connected.  After a long wait on the phone with Roku to get a tech, the tech determined after about an hour that my WiFi router channel was conflicting with the Roku remote/base.  Had to change the Router channel then re-pair the remote and base.  After about 2 hours total time, it is up and working.  Once it was running, I like it. Plenty of channels to add for free (some have really limited content of course) but like the Netflix and Amazon fast access buttons.  Video quality is good.  I think I'll like this device now that it is up and running.
author: J. Crocetto "Audio-man"

review: I've had Roku since the beginning of it's existence & this is my 7th. Not because they failed or wore out but because I upgrade to the newer models and give away my older ones to other family members. This model was the perfect solution for the limited space of our tiny upstairs bedroom & it streams just as well as any of the other Roku's I've owned. The only negative I can find, which is more of a slight annoyance than a negative, is that the remote is a little slow to respond leaving you clicking the button frantically & wondering if it froze up at first, however, you get used to it quickly & that issue does seem to be improving. Other than the "Stick" I currently have 2 Roku 3's. I havent cut the cord completely because I live in a rural valley where TV reception is virtually nonexistent but I have cut back to just basic cable for the local channels. I highly recommend ROKU of any flavor to everyone, especially if you're sick & tired of paying through the nose for 500+ channels you never even watch..*Update: I deducted a star. The stick mostly works great but occasionally loses network connection and will not reconnect on it's own due to "Incorrect Network Security". I have to manually go back through network setup to get it to reconnect. I do not have to actually re-enter any info, just click through the setup. Happens once or twice a week and is a bit annoying...
author: PC Guy "Keith"
